hints.content:
To find the $\goldE{\text{total}}$ number of school busses, we start with the number of $\blueE{\text{Smiley School District}}$ busses, and add the number of $\maroonD{\text{Brighter School District}}$ busses.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/0ae4ddceb8e87f54103b1a0b7f610b188ec60aff)

$\blueE{65} + \maroonD{34} = \goldE{\Box}$

Let's add to find the total number of school busses.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/eae543680e3a33b58ecc3bd2c91b1f18bf162ed7)

$\blueE{65} + \maroonD{34} = \goldE{99}$
Smiley and Brighter school district have $\goldE{99}$ school buses in all.

question.content:
Smiley School District has $65$ school buses.   Brighter School District has $34$ school buses.  

**How many school buses do both school districts have in all?**  

[[â˜ƒ input-number 1]] school buses
